Description: Limestone fragment: composed of two sides of an original block with the nomen of Merenptah on one side and the name of Hathor on the other, possibly the remains of a pedestal. This fragment consists of two pieces broken in antiquity and rejoined in modern times. The fragments are chipped along the edges. Both parts exhibit possible traces of burning. There are no traces of colour.
Curator's comments: For another fragment from the same site, see 1849,0811.211c. Several faience fragments with the name of Merenptah were acquired at the same time as the above piece (R. Weill, 'Recueil des Inscriptions égyptiennes du Sinai '(Paris, 1904), 220-1). Bibliography: J. D. Cooney, 'Journal of Egyptian Archaeology' 58 (1972), 284; K.A. Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' Vol. 7 (Oxford: Blackwell Press), 217.
Bibliographic references: Bierbrier 1982 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 10. (pl.24)
Condition: Good. This fragment consists of two pieces broken in antiquity and rejoined in modern times. The fragments are chipped along the edges. Both parts exhibit possible traces of burning.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Maj Charles Kerr Macdonald
